other_tests.findings: Histological analysis revealed a florid granulomatous response with scattered small round organisms, and no evidence of malignant cells. Thick-walled, encapsulated cryptococcal organisms were identified.
Surgical findings included a well-circumscribed mass consisting of thick mucinous fluid. Cryptococcus neoformans was isolated from intraoperative cultures.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the one-year follow-up, the patient's activity level was nearly normal with no symptoms of systemic infection. At eighteen months postoperatively, no recurrent disease was evident.

other_tests.procedure_name: Testing for HIV and CD4 count
other_tests.findings: Negative findings for HIV; normal CD4 count.
